name: Ursula Hegi's "Stones From the River" Quiz | Literature | 20 Questions

questions.text: The main character is a swerg, or _______.
questions.explanation:
dwarf.

	Her name is Trudi Montag and she is a strong, brave girl and woman. Yet she is not perfect. She can be spiteful, envious, and vindictive.

questions.text: Why does Trudi's mother hide under the house?
options: She is hiding from the SS.
She is playing hide and seek with Trudi.
questions.explanation:
She is crazy.

	Trudi's mother Gertrud is crazy from the time of Trudi's birth. Yet, Trudi loves her mother very much and spends a lot of time with her until Gertrud's death when Trudi is 4.

questions.text: Which is the best description of Trudi's father, Leo?
questions.explanation:
He is very kind.

	All of the women of Burgdorf are attracted to Leo Montag, but he remains true to his dead wife. He was very kind and loving to his wife, daughter, and to everyone in town. Many people come to him with their troubles and he always listens sympathetically.

questions.text: What do Trudi and her father do for a living?
options: They own a large apartment building.
questions.explanation:
They run a pay library.

	Most of the books in the library are romances, cowboy tales, and thrillers. Leo has his own library of literary works, but most of these are banned during the Nazi years.

questions.text: Who is NEVER a friend of Trudi's?
questions.explanation:
Hans-Jurgen Braunmeier.

	Hans-Jurgen is a cruel little boy who grows up to be a serial murderer. He is one of four boys who sexually assault Trudi in the Braunmeiers' barn.

questions.text: Who is Seehund?
questions.explanation:
Trudi's dog.

	The dog's name means "seal", or "sea dog", yet he is afraid of water. He is a loving, faithful dog all of his life.

questions.text: Why does Trudi end up hating many of those she loves?
options: because they join the Nazi party
questions.explanation:
because they betray her.

	Many of Trudi's friends become ashamed to be friends with her because she is a dwarf. This happens with Eva, Georg, and Klaus. Her friend Ingrid never feels this way, however. Neither does Jutta or Max.

questions.text: True or false: This book is critical of the Catholic Church.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Although there are some admirable characters in the book who are Catholics (such as a few Catholic clergymen who help Jews to escape), the author seems to feel that the majority of priests and nuns acted in a hypocritical, cowardly mannner during the war.

questions.text: Who is Pia?
questions.correct: another swerg who is an animal trainer
options: a religious fanatic who kills her own daughter
a Jewish woman who hides under Trudi's house
an artist who marries the town dentist
questions.explanation:
another swerg who is an animal trainer.

	Pia is very important to Trudi, because the animal trainer teaches the girl that there are many other small people in the world, and that she is just as good as other people.

questions.text: Trudi has many skills, talents, and interests. Which seems most important?
questions.explanation:
her storytelling.

	Trudi uses storytelling to relate to other people and sustain herself through hard times. Once, her talent even saves her life when she tells an inventive tale to a Nazi officer who holds her prisoner.

questions.text: How does Trudi first begin to help Jews?
questions.correct: She hides a mother and son in her home.
options: She works as a "double agent" in the SS.
She stops Nazis from destroying Jewish people's shops and homes.
She joins a plot to assassinate Hitler.
questions.explanation:
She hides a mother and son in her home.

	Trudi, her father, and several other brave townspeople hide Jews in their homes and help them escape from Germany.

questions.text: Who gives Trudi her first kiss?
questions.explanation:
Klaus Malter.

	The dentist kisses her while they are dancing, but later he seems ashamed of this.

questions.text: How does Trudi meet Max Rudnick?
options: He is engaged to her best friend Ingrid.
questions.explanation:
She answers his newspaper ad.

	When Max advertises for a lady friend, Trudi writes a fake response, describing herself as "Angelica", a tall, beautiful woman. She waits for the duped recipient in a cafe and gives him a fake note from "Angelica", saying he is too pitiful to consider. Max soon figures out the ruse, and becomes interested in Trudi. Much later, they become lovers.

questions.text: Does Trudi ever marry?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Perhaps she would have married Max, but he is killed in the bombing of Dresden.

questions.text: What are the first signs of Nazism in Burgdorf?
options: Jews losing their homes and businesses
neighbors turning each other in for disloyalty to Hitler
questions.explanation:
kids in doe-brown uniforms.

	The first character to show up in a Hitler Jugen uniform is Helmut Eberhardt, who later turns in his mother to the Nazis.

questions.text: True or false: Jews are not as badly treated in Burgdorf as they are in larger cities.
questions.explanation:
False.

	At first it seems that way, but Burgdorf soon catches up with the rest of Germany.

questions.text: When does Trudi's father die?
questions.explanation:
after the war.

	He dies near the end of the novel. Trudi is in her 30s by this time. The whole town grieves and tries to help Trudi with her grief.

questions.text: Who is the unknown benefactor?
questions.explanation:
Emil Hesping.

	Emil is the same man who was in a motorcycle accident with Trudi's mother (and possibly had an affair with her) while Leo was fighting in World War I. Emil embezzled money in order to buy surprise gifts for the people of Burgdorf. He also engineered a sort of underground railway for Jews escaping the Nazis.

questions.text: Why does Alexander Strum kill himself?
questions.correct: because he allows the SS to take his wife, who is Jewish
options: because his business fails and his wife leaves him
because his wife goes crazy and dies in an asylum
because he cannot live with his war crimes as an SS officer
questions.explanation:
because he allows the SS to take his wife, who is Jewish.

	Alexander marries Eva Rosen. Trudi hides Eva, but the young wife sneaks back to spend the night with her husband. The next morning, the SS comes for her.

questions.text: Who are Stefan and Helene?
questions.correct: Trudi's uncle and aunt in America
questions.explanation:
Trudi's uncle and aunt in America.

	Ursula Hegi wrote another book about Trudi's relatives who moved to New Hampshire.
